name: Patricia and Barry NOLL, H/W, Petitioner, v. Paul L. KEAGY, Individual and T/D/B/A Paul L. Keagy & Son, and Paul L, Keagy's Produce and Boscov's Department Store and Fairgrounds Farmers Market, Respondent

parties: Patricia and Barry NOLL, H/W, Petitioner, v. Paul L. KEAGY, Individual and T/D/B/A Paul L. Keagy & Son, and Paul L, Keagy’s Produce and Boscov’s Department Store and Fairgrounds Farmers Market, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 10th day of November, 1997, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The decision of the Superior Court is REVERSED and the case is REMANDED to the Court of Common Pleas of Philadelphia County for further proceedings. See Cheeseman v. Lethal Exterminator, Inc., 549 Pa. 200, 701 A.2d 156 (1997).
Jurisdiction is relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: John F. Hanahan, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
702 A.2d 362
Patricia and Barry NOLL, H/W, Petitioner, v. Paul L. KEAGY, Individual and T/D/B/A Paul L. Keagy & Son, and Paul L, Keagy’s Produce and Boscov’s Department Store and Fairgrounds Farmers Market, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 10, 1997.
John F. Hanahan, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
